name: Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt
biography: Daughter of industrialist Peter Cooper, Sarah Amelia Cooper married her brother’s friend, Abram Hewitt, who became a U. S. Congressman and Mayor of New York City. They had six children—two of whom, Sarah and Eleanor, founded the Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration. Sarah Amelia had a passion for collecting French decorative arts and garden design. She once noted that she could not paint a picture, but she could design one.
